newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine GDP to grow 4.0 pct in 96 - govt official. [CORRECTED 18:33 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Argentine GDP to grow 4.0 pct in 96 - govt official. [CORRECTED 18:33 GMT]

text.p: Argentina's economy will grow by 4.0 percent in 1996 with officials revising second quarter growth sharply upward from the 2.6 percent (corrects from 3.2 percent) estimated previously, Planning Secretary Eugenio Pendaz said Monday.
In a briefing with reporters, Pendaz added Argentina's industrial production in October was "more than 12 percent" higher than in October 1995.
"GDP will grow 4.0 percent a year and the level of (economic) output will be the same level as in 1994," Pendaz said.

Commenting on industrial production last month, the planning secretary said, "The cement sector is growing very strongly along with refined petroleum, cars, tires and consumer goods. We are reaching and surpassing 1994."
He added that trade figures are reflecting a strong influx of capital and more positive economic picture.
"We are expecting a trade figure that is very balanced," he said, predicting either a very small deficit or surplus depending on grains prices.
